title: World War I
subtitle: The Great War (1914-1918)
narrator: James, age 18, American soldier in France, 1918

sections.title: The Great War Begins
sections.summary: I'm James, eighteen years old, and I'm an American soldier in France. The war has been raging since 1914—four years of brutal combat that has killed millions and devastated Europe. The war started with the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria-Hungary in June 1914.

sections.title: Over There—American Doughboys in France
sections.summary:
"Over there, over there, Send the word, send the word over there, That the Yanks are coming, the Yanks are coming... And we won't come back till it's over, over there."

George M. Cohan's song captures American enthusiasm as we entered the war.

sections.title: The Tide Turns
sections.summary: By spring 1918, Germany launched a massive offensive, trying to win before American troops arrived in force. They broke through Allied lines, advancing toward Paris. For weeks, the outcome was uncertain.

sections.title: Wilson's Fourteen Points and the Treaty of Versailles
sections.summary:
President Wilson arrived in Paris for the peace conference with an idealistic vision. His Fourteen Points, announced in January 1918, outlined principles for lasting peace:

• No secret treaties—open diplomacy
• Freedom of the seas
• Free trade among nations
• Reduced armaments
• Adjustment of colon...

sections.title: Coming Home to a Changed Nation
sections.summary: The Senate rejected the Treaty of Versailles and refused to join the League of Nations. Wilson toured the country promoting the treaty, but suffered a stroke that left him partially paralyzed. Without his leadership, the treaty died.

key_facts: I'm James, eighteen years old, and I'm an American soldier in France.
"Over there, over there, Send the word, send the word over there, That the Yanks are coming, the Yanks are coming...
By spring 1918, Germany launched a massive offensive, trying to win before American troops arrived in force.
President Wilson arrived in Paris for the peace conference with an idealistic vision.
The Senate rejected the Treaty of Versailles and refused to join the League of Nations.

vocabulary.definition: Global conflict (1914-1918) between Allied and Central Powers.
Brutal WWI combat from fortified trenches, causing massive casualties.
German message to Mexico proposing alliance against U.S., helping push America into war.
President who led America in WWI and proposed League of Nations.
Wilson's peace plan including self-determination and League of Nations.
International organization Wilson proposed to prevent future wars—U.S. Senate rejected it.
